snippet: In a world of million-dollar auctions and big-ticket, blockbuster museum exhibitions, a nonprofit group is trying to make art, or at least its notion of art, more accessible....
abstract: Nonprofit arts organization Figment, which sponsors annual participatory art festival on Governors Island, has grown into grass-roots movement with free events in 18 cities; miniature golf course, with each hole created by different artist, is favorite for visitors.
lead_paragraph: In a world of million-dollar auctions and big-ticket, blockbuster museum exhibitions, a nonprofit group is trying to make art, or at least its notion of art, more accessible.

headline.main: On Governors Island, Family-Friendly Art With a Stroke of Whimsy
headline.print_headline: A Ferry Ride From Galleries, Family-Friendly Art With a Stroke of Whimsy
